hints.MOLECULARCLOCK: Estimation of evolutionary timescales based on mutation rates
hints.COEVOLUTION: Reciprocal evolutionary changes between interacting species
hints.SELECTION: _______ PRESSURE - Environmental factors that influence reproductive success
hints.DRIFT: GENETIC _____ - Random changes in allele frequencies in a population
hints.HOMOLOGOUS: Anatomical similarities due to shared ancestry
hints.PUNCTUATED: _______ EQUILIBRIUM - The idea that evolution occurs in rapid bursts rather than gradually
hints.GENEFLOW: Movement of genes between populations through migration
hints.FREQUENCY: ALLELE _______ - This refers to the proportion of a specific allele (variant of a gene) within a population's gene pool
hints.MICROEVOLUTION: This refers to evolutionary changes within a population or species over a relatively short period of time
hints.SYMBIOSIS: Long-term interaction between different species, often mutually beneficial
hints.BOTTLENECK: The effect that refers to a sharp reduction in population size causing genetic diversity loss
hints.PHYLOGENY: Evolutionary history and relationships among species
hints.FOUNDER: The effect which refers to genetic variation resulting from a small group establishing a new population
hints.ADAPTIVE: ______ RADIATION - The rapid evolution of multiple species from a common ancestor
